business.headline: Government to monitor airline prices amid holiday travel surgeThe festive season typically sees a spike in travel demand, which often leads to increased ticket prices.

Caught in a whirlwind: Sebi's Madhabi Puri Buch faces mounting scrutinyUnder increasing pressure from external allegations and internal unrest, Sebi Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch faces a turbulent period marked by accusations of conflict of interest and claims of a toxic work culture. The path ahead remains uncertain.

18% GST on transactions under Rs 2,000 awaits fitment committee's call: ReportThe GST council did not make a final decision and chose to refer the issue to the fitment committee for further analysis and recommendations.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Should you subscribe or skip?Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: The company aims to raise up to Rs 7,000 crore through the IPO, which includes both fresh equity and an offer-for-sale component.
Volkswagen proposes first-ever factory closure in Germany. Why it's a big deal?Volkswagen's management has revealed that the company's core brand needs to save 10 billion euros by 2026.
IndiGo plans to double international routes to 40 by year-end: ReportThe plan is part of a broader strategy to establish IndiGo as a leading global airline by 2030.

GST Council Meeting: Major relief likely for insurance buyers? The Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council, which is meeting on September 9, 2024, in New Delhi, is expected to discuss the possibility of removing the 18% GST on term life insurance premiums.
Adani Group warns Bangladesh over $500 million in unpaid power duesDespite recent growth, Bangladesh continues to face chronic energy shortages, worsened by dwindling domestic gas reserves.

Gala Precision Engineering makes solid market debut. Hold or sell? Gala Precision Engineering IPO listing: The shares of the company made a strong debut, listing at a 42% premium over the issue price on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: 10 points you need to knowThe proceeds from this public offering will be used to strengthen Bajaj Housing Finance's capital base, positioning it to meet future business needs.

GST Council Meet today: Insurance tax, payment aggregators — what to expectGST Council Meeting: The session is expected to address several critical topics, including the taxation of insurance premiums, proposed rate rationalisations, and more.

Should you apply for Bajaj Housing Finance IPO? Check GMP, expected gainsBajaj Housing Finance IPO: Investors are anticipating strong listing gains, as indicated by the company's grey market premium (GMP).

Sensex, Nifty open lower as weak US jobs data reignites recession fearsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 181.90 points at 81,002 at 9:19 am, while the NSE NIfty50 declined 49.55 points to trade at 24,802.60.

Maximising returns: How to select top mutual funds for your portfolioMutual funds have emerged as a popular investment option, offering a balanced approach to growing wealth without the complexity of managing individual stocks.

'Multiple call recordings exist': Byju's cries foul after auditor BDO resignsIn a strong response to BDO's resignation, Byju's has accused the audit firm of making unethical requests and manipulating the audit process, including suggesting the backdating of financial reports.

Byju's crisis worsens as second auditor BDO resigns over financial concernsBDO's exit comes just a year after Deloitte, the company's previous auditor, stepped down citing problems with Byju's financial reporting.
Payment aggregators may face 18% GST for transactions up to Rs 2,000: ReportThe final decision will be made at the GST Council's 54th meeting, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

US adds 1,42,000 jobs in August; unemployment rate drops to 4.2%While the job data fell short of expectations, a slight dip in the unemployment rate to 4.2% indicated that the labour market is gradually cooling off, but not dramatically.

IPO investors are not looking beyond listing gains, are they missing out?According to a Sebi study, 70% of the shares, by value, were sold within a year of the IPO. The quick turnover is particularly noticeable in cases where IPO shares see a strong rise in value right after listing.

Anant Ambani donates 20 kg gold crown worth Rs 15 crore to Lalbaugcha RajaLalbaugcha Raja, Mumbai's most popular Ganesh idol, was unveiled on Thursday ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi. Devotees visit the Lalbaugcha Raja for darshan during the 10-day Ganesh festival.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Talks between AAP, Congress for Haryana alliance fail over seat-sharing: SourcesAccording to sources, the AAP wanted to contest on at least 10 seats but the Congress wasn't willing to spare more than three for the Arvind Kejriwal-led party.

Mamata Banerjee denies offering money to doctor's family, calls it slanderWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee asserted that no money was offered to the doctor's parents by Kolkata Police, dismissing the allegations as slander against her government.

Kolkata horror: Supreme Court flags 'missing' paper, warns doctors to resume work A Supreme Court bench headed by Chief Justice DY Chandrachud asked the CBI to file a fresh status report in the Kolkata rape-murder case by next Tuesday.

Caught in a whirlwind: Sebi's Madhabi Puri Buch faces mounting scrutinyUnder increasing pressure from external allegations and internal unrest, Sebi Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch faces a turbulent period marked by accusations of conflict of interest and claims of a toxic work culture. The path ahead remains uncertain.

Bangladesh targets Indian plate and palette, bans Padma hilsa for Durga PujaBangladesh had sent a 4,000-tonne consignment of Padma hilsa, considered to be tastier than the Indian varieties, before Durga Puja last year. Post-Hasina, Bangladesh has banned hilsa export in the months leading to Durga Puja in an assault on Indian plates and palettes. But hilsa-loving Indians seem to have found a way to skirt the ban.

Traitor can't understand RSS: Union Minister on Rahul Gandhi's remarks in US Union Minister Giriraj Singh criticised Rahul Gandhi, stating that a "traitor" cannot understand the RSS, in response to the Congress MP's recent remarks about the ideological differences between the Congress party and the RSS.
Volkswagen proposes first-ever factory closure in Germany. Why it's a big deal?Volkswagen's management has revealed that the company's core brand needs to save 10 billion euros by 2026.

How sure-footed India is best-placed to end Russia-Ukraine warIndia's diplomatic efforts to end the Russia-Ukraine war have gathered pace. National Security Advisor Ajit Doval is travelling to Russia and Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be in the US after that. India is in a unique position to broker peace, having walked an independent line in a bipolar world, and done business with both camps.

Paralympians outscore Olympians 5:1 in medals tally; here's whyIndian para-athletes scripted history at the Paris Paralympics, winning 29 medals, 10 more than their previous best tally from Tokyo. When the Indian contingent suffered from the curse of near-misses in the Olympics, the para-athletes delivered consistently on the big stage.

Congress to name more Haryana candidates today, suspense on 3 seats: SourcesSources also said that all Congress MPs from Haryana have expressed a desire to contest the assembly elections. The sub-committee has finalised candidates for 49 seats but has left the decision on three key constituencies to the brass.
Chinese man, 30, dies after working for 104 days straight with 1 day offA Chinese man died from organ failure after working for 104 consecutive days with only one day off.
Screen suspects, trace contacts: Health ministry's mpox advisory to statesThe health ministry has issued an advisory to states to track and monitor cases of mpox.
Video: Schoolgirl lifts auto-rickshaw, saves mother trapped underneathThe mother was struck by the auto-rickshaw while crossing the road to pick up her daughter from a tuition center.

Actor Vikas Sethi's wife on his final hours: He didn't want to be hospitalisedActor Vikas Sethi, known for his performances in many popular TV shows, died on Saturday night in his sleep. His wife, Jhanvi Sethi, now revealed what happened during the last hours before his death.

Accident averted as train screeches to halt after hitting LPG cylinder in KanpurThe Kanpur Police claimed that an attempt was made to derail the Kalindi Express by placing an LPG cylinder on the tracks. A bottle of petrol and matchboxes were also recovered from the spot.

Tamil actor Jayam Ravi and wife Aarti announce separationTamil actor Jayam Ravi and his wife Aarti announced their separation on September 9. They were married for 15 years and are parents to two sons.
Hyundai Alcazar 2024 launched at Rs 14.99 lakhHyundai Alcazar 2024 sits between the Hyundai Creta 2024 and the Hyundai Tucson in the carmaker's SUV line-up.
Video: Vande Bharat loco pilots clash over operating Udaipur-Agra trainA video showing a scuffle between Vande Bharat loco pilots over operating the train has gone viral.

Ready to contest all seats: Haryana AAP's evening deadline for Congress poll pactAAP's Haryana Unit Chief, Sushil Gupta, said they have received no information regarding the alliance with Congress and stated that they will release a list of all 90 candidates if there is no update by the end of Monday.

Dalit girl gang-raped, hit with bricks in Lucknow, 1 arrestedA Dalit girl was brutally gang-raped by two men in Lucknow and her head was also hit by the accused when she was going to a local eatery in Lucknow. One of the accused has been arrested by the police.

Autopsy done without formal request? Supreme Court's top quotesThe Supreme Court heard the rape and murder of a postgraduate trainee doctor at Kolkata's RG Kar Medical College and Hospital on Monday. The court questioned the Bengal government about the autopsy's execution without formal authorisation and directed the CBI to submit a fresh report by September 17.

Rahul Gandhi, in US, says fear of BJP vanished after 2024 Lok Sabha pollsCongress leader Rahul Gandhi, who is on a visit to the US, said the people lost their fear of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP following the 2024 Lok Sabha election results.

Vinesh Phogat boosts Congress in Jat belt, woos youth-women, can she deliver Haryana?Vinesh Phogat's entry will boost the Congress party's chances because of her popularity among Jats, farmers, women, and the youth.

Did Chandrayaan-3 record 250 quakes on the Moon? The Instrument for Lunar Seismic Activity (ILSA) aboard the Vikram Lander detected 250 seismic signatures during its operational period from August 24 to September 4, 2023.

Watch: Nancy Tyagi creates stunning white gown from scratch for Ananya PandaySocial media influencer and fashion designer Nancy Tyagi recently created a beautiful white gown for actor Ananya Panday. She shared the process of designing the outfit in a video on Instagram.

Vijay's last 8 films grossed Rs 200 crore each. Why is he truly the GOAT?Thalapathy Vijay is the only Tamil actor to have eight Rs 200 crore grossing films in his career. His latest film, The Greatest of All Time, is the latest addition to the list.

Pics: Aamir Khan performs aarti with son Azad, sister Nikhat on Ganesh Chaturthi Aamir Khan recently celebrated Ganesh Chaturthi at his sister Nikhat's home in Mumbai. The actor was also joined by his son Azad Rao.

Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce's video will make you believe in a thing called lovePop idol Taylor Swift attended the US Open on Sunday, September 8, along with her boyfriend, footballer Travis Kelce. Their animated sing-along is now going viral.

sports.headline: Asian Champions Trophy: India thrash Japan 5-1 to extend winning run India continued their dominant run in the Asian Champions Trophy, securing a commanding 5-1 victory over Japan. With two consecutive wins, the defending champions have firmly established themselves as the team to beat.

South Africa name fresh faces for ODIs, T20Is against Ireland and AfghanistanSouth Africa announced the squad for the upcoming white-ball series against Afghanistan and Ireland beginning from September 18.

Australia hopeful of reclaiming Border-Gavaskar Trophy in huge summer: Josh HazlewoodBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Australia's pace spearhead Josh Hazlewood said Pat Cummins-led side is keen on ending India's series-winning streak in Test cricket. Rohit Sharma-led India will tour Australia for a five-Test series from November to January.

Why Kerala Blasters snubbed chance to sign Italy's Mario BalotelliKerala Blasters surprised football fans by rejecting Mario Balotelli due to disciplinary concerns and financial impracticality. Despite his global fame, the club opted for a cautious approach in their summer transfer decisions.

OTD: Sachin Tendulkar scores maiden ODI hundred vs AustraliaSachin Tendulkar scored his maiden ODI hundred on September 9, 1994 against Australia at R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo. Opening the innings, he played a magnificent knock of 110 (130).

Inspired by local hero Sheetal Devi, teen without arms and legs begins trainingA viral video shows a 13-year-old girl from Sheetal Devi's village training in archery under the same coach, despite having no legs and arms. Her determination reflects the inspiring journey of India's Paralympic bronze medalist.

ENG vs SL: Josh Hull's 'slingy' action reminds Stuart Broad of Mitchell JohnsonFormer England fast bowler Stuart Broad has said that Josh Hull's action reminds him of Mitchell Johnson. Hull made his debut in the ongoing third Test against Sri Lanka at the Oval.

Jannik Sinner reacts to 'Big 3' absence from Grand Slams: Nice for new championsJannik Sinner's US Open triumph after beating Taylor Fritz solidifies a new era in tennis, marking the first year without a "Big Three" Grand Slam champion, as fresh faces like his and Carlos Alcaraz's redefine the sport's competitive landscape.

American dream crashes after Taylor Fritz, Jessica Pegula lose US Open 2024: Taylor Fritz and Jessica Pegula could not survive the heat in the final after losing to Jannik Sinner and Aryna Sabalenka at the Arthur Ashe Stadium.

ENG vs SL: Jamie Smith's rescue act draws massive Adam Gilchrist comparisonEngland assistant coach Paul Collingwood has drawn a massive Adam Gilchrist comparison for Jamie Smith after his gutsy fifty on Day 3 of the third Test against Sri Lanka.

US Open or Australian Open, which tournament was difficult to win? Sinner revealsJannik Sinner opened up on which tournament was difficult to win out of his two grand slam titles, the Australian Open or the US Open. Sinner beat Taylor Fritz to win the US Open 2024 on Monday, September 9.

Babar Azam greeted with loud cheers from fans before Champions Cup Babar Azam got a rousing reception from fans at the Iqbal Stadium in Faisalabad before the Champions One-Day Cup. Babar recently had a poor outing after Pakistan lost to Bangladesh in the 2-match Test series.

Upset Taylor Fritz apologises after losing US Open final to Jannik SinnerUSA's Taylor Fritz apologised to the fans after losing the US Open final to Jannik Sinner on Sunday. Fritz was blown away by the Italian in straight sets in just 2 hours and 16 minutes.

Sherfane Rutherford pulls out of CPL 2024 for personal reasonsSherfane Rutherford of the St Kitts and Nevis Patriots would not be a part of the remaining CPL 2024 matches after pulling out due to personal reasons.

Cruise ships, hotels: Japan set to ditch Games Village in Asiad 2026Japan are set to ditch the traditional Games Village in the 2026 Asiad, announced Tsunekazu Takeda, former president of the Japan Olympic Committee. The groundbreaking decision has not gone down well ith everyone.

Paralympics closing ceremony: Rainy Paris bids goodbye with sensational DJ partyThe Paris Paralympics came to a close with a stunning DJ party at the Stade de France on Sunday, September 8. A rainy Paris said goodbye to the Paralympians before passing on the baton to LA.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
